VRDisplay.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The VRDisplay interface of the WebVR API represents any VR device supported by this API. It includes generic information such as device IDs and descriptions, as well as methods for starting to present a VR scene, retrieving eye parameters and display capabilities, and other important functionality.

blockquote.para: This interface was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: An array of all connected VR Devices can be returned by invoking the method.

VRDisplayCancelAnimationFrame.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The cancelAnimationFrame() method of the interface is a special implementation of that unregisters callbacks registered with .

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayCapabilities.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The capabilities read-only property of the interface returns a object that indicates the various capabilities of the VRDisplay.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayDepthFar.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The depthFar property of the interface gets and sets the z-depth defining the far plane of the eye view frustum, i.e., the furthest viewable boundary of the scene.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: Generally you should leave the value as is, but you might want to reduce it if you are trying to improve performance on slower computers.

VRDisplayDepthFar.value:
A double, representing the z-depth in meters.
It initial value is 10000.0.

VRDisplayDepthNear.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The depthNear property of the interface gets and sets the z-depth defining the near plane of the eye view frustum, i.e., the nearest viewable boundary of the scene.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: Generally you should leave the value as is, but you might want to increase it if you are trying to improve performance on slower computers, and/or your UI makes sense with the near boundary made further away.

VRDisplayDepthNear.value: A double, representing the z-depth in meters; its initial value is 0.01.

VRDisplayDisplayId.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The displayId read-only property of the interface returns an identifier for this particular VRDisplay, which is also used as an association point in the Gamepad API (see ).

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayDisplayId.value: A number representing the ID of the specific VRDisplay.

VRDisplayDisplayName.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The displayName read-only property of the interface returns a human-readable name to identify the VRDisplay.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This will generally be something like "Oculus VR HMD (HMD)" or "Oculus VR HMD (Sensor)".

VRDisplayDisplayName.value: A string containing the human-readable name of the specific VR display.

VRDisplayExitPresent.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The exitPresent() method of the interface stops the VRDisplay presenting a scene.

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayExitPresent.returns: A promise that resolves once the presentation has ended. If the VRDisplay is not presenting when exitPresent() is called, the promise will reject.

VRDisplayGetEyeParameters.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The getEyeParameters() method of the interface returns the object containing the eye parameters for the specified eye.

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayGetEyeParameters.returns: A object, or null if the VR is not able to present content (e.g., returns false).

VRDisplayGetFrameData.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The getFrameData() method of the interface accepts a object and populates it with the information required to render the current frame.

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This includes the and view and projection matrices for the current frame.

VRDisplayGetFrameData.returns: A boolean value — a value of true is returned if the object was successfully populated, or false if it wasn't.

VRDisplayGetImmediatePose.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The getImmediatePose() method of the interface returns a object defining the current pose of the VRDisplay, with no prediction applied.

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayGetLayers.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The getLayers() method of the interface returns the layers currently being presented by the VRDisplay.

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayGetLayers.returns: If the is presenting, this method returns an array of the objects currently being presented (this will currently be one, as is currently always 1). If the is not presenting, this method returns an empty array.

VRDisplayGetPose.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The getPose() method of the interface returns a object defining the future predicted pose of the VRDisplay as it will be when the current frame is actually presented.

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.
It was even deprecated there — instead, you should use , which also provides a object.

VRDisplayIsConnected.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The isConnected read-only property of the interface returns a boolean value indicating whether the VRDisplay is connected to the computer.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayIsConnected.value: A boolean value; true means the display is connected; false means it isn't.

VRDisplayIsPresenting.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The isPresenting read-only property of the interface returns a boolean value indicating whether the VRDisplay is currently having content presented through it.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayIsPresenting.value: A boolean value; true means the display is presenting; false means it isn't.

VRDisplayRequestAnimationFrame.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The requestAnimationFrame() method of the interface is a special implementation of containing a callback function that will be called every time a new frame of the VRDisplay presentation is rendered:

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayRequestAnimationFrame.returns: A long representing the handle of the requestAnimationFrame() call. This can then be passed to a call to unregister the callback.

VRDisplayRequestPresent.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The requestPresent() method of the interface starts the VRDisplay presenting a scene.

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayRequestPresent.returns: A promise that resolves once the presentation has begun. There are a number of rules surrounding the promise's fulfillment or rejection:

VRDisplayResetPose.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The resetPose() method of the interface resets the pose for the VRDisplay, treating its current and as the "origin/zero" values.

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: After resetPost() has been called, future poses returned from / will describe positions relative to the VRDisplay's position when resetPose() was last called and will treat the display's yaw when resetPose() was last called as the forward orientation.
The VRDisplay's reported roll and pitch do not change when resetPose() is called as they are relative to gravity. Calling resetPose() may change the matrix.

VRDisplayStageParameters.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The stageParameters read-only property of the interface returns a object containing room-scale parameters, if the VRDisplay is capable of supporting room-scale experiences.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayStageParameters.value: object containing the VRDisplay's room-scale parameters, or null if the VRDisplay is not capable of supporting room-scale experiences.

VRDisplaySubmitFrame.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The submitFrame() method of the interface captures the current state of the currently being presented and displays it on the VRDisplay.

blockquote.para: This method was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: The frame should subsequently be rendered using the and matrices provided by the last call to .
